meanings.definition: The quality or state of being reclusive.
meanings.sent1: Her reclusiveness made it difficult for her to make new friends.
meanings.sent2: His reclusiveness was evident in his preference for solitude over social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his reclusiveness, he still managed to charm everyone with his wit when he did interact with others.
meanings.sent4: The garden, with its high walls and overgrown bushes, seemed to embody the reclusiveness of its owner.
meanings.sent5: The reclusiveness of the old mansion added an air of mystery to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The tendency to avoid social interaction.
meanings.sent1: She felt overwhelmed by the reclusiveness she experienced in large crowds.
meanings.sent2: His reclusiveness often led to misunderstandings with his colleagues at work.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reclusiveness was evident as it hid under the bed whenever guests visited.
meanings.sent4: The reclusiveness of the forest creatures added to the enchantment of the woods.
meanings.sent5: The reclusiveness of the shy student made it challenging for the teacher to engage them in class activities.
